channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Taliban capture Kandahar, Afghanistan's second largest city
item.description: Kandahar's fall is a crushing blow for the government, as the militants continue their offensive.

item.title: Afghanistan: Desperation as thousands flee the Taliban
item.description: Yogita Limaye reports from a camp in Kabul where thousands who have been displaced by violence seek refuge.

item.title: Britney Spears' father to step down as conservator
item.description: The star had requested Jamie Spears be removed after accusing him of "conservatorship abuse".

item.title: Lee Jae-yong: Samsung heir released from prison on parole
item.description: Critics say the move raises fresh questions about the preferential treatment of business leaders.

item.title: US census: Hispanic and Asian-American driving US population growth
item.description: Newly released data points to sluggish population growth and a more multiracial US.

item.title: Lord of the Rings: Amazon moves show to UK from New Zealand
item.description: The multi-million dollar production is one of the most expensive shows in the history of television.

item.title: North Korea airs Olympics coverage days after it ends
item.description: Korean Central Television airs a women's football match that was actually played last month.

item.title: Wagner: Gaddafi's son faces arrest over Russian mercenaries
item.description: A warrant is issued against Saif al-Islam Gaddafi after a BBC investigation into mercenaries in Libya.

item.title: Covid booster: US approves third jab for the immunocompromised
item.description: It marks the first time US health officials have indicated that Covid booster shots may be needed.

item.title: Picasso masterpieces to go on sale in blockbuster auction
item.description: Proceeds could reach $100m in what is thought to be the most valuable auction of the artist's works.

item.title: Russia holds hypersonic flight expert in spy probe
item.description: Alexander Kuranov, detained by FSB agents, runs a team of pioneering spaceflight researchers.

item.title: Brazil Congress expels lawmaker over murder charges
item.description: Gospel singer turned lawmaker Flordelis de Souza is accused of ordering the murder of her husband.

item.title: Afghanistan: How the Taliban gained ground so quickly
item.description: The situation looks bleak for the Afghan government, but there may still be a chance of a stalemate.

item.title: The murderous crime wave sweeping Israel's Arabs
item.description: Many killings often go unsolved, with blame being put on the police.

item.title: Life in a town taken by the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: BBC correspondent Secunder Kermani reports from a town in Afghanistan recently taken by the Taliban

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 6-12 August 2021
item.description: A selection of the best photos from the African continent and beyond.

item.title: 365 dates: Indian serial dater Sunder Ramu still looking to meet his target
item.description: Tamil actor Sunder Ramu's dates are not all romantic ones - and his aim is not just to find love.

item.title: The fiendish new trick cyber-criminals are using to evade capture
item.description: Bitcoin researchers discover a new darknet tool criminals are using to help launder their digital money.

item.title: Kiwi Chow: The filmmaker who took Hong Kong's protests to Cannes
item.description: Kiwi Chow's documentary was a surprise at the film festival - and it has a controversial title.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Do the Taliban want to conquer or compromise?
item.description: The BBC speaks to two high profile figures in its chain of command who have very different messages.

item.title: Northern Turkey hit by severe flash flooding
item.description: Seventeen people have reportedly died, with more than 1,400 people evacuated from the areas affected.

item.title: Virtual reality: 'There's no max, there's no limit!'
item.description: "There's no max, there's no limit" to virtual reality, so is it the future of live music?

item.title: Wildfires rage in Algeria as heatwave hits North Africa
item.description: The blazes in the mountainous Kabylie region are some of the worst in the country's history.
